question: Which organisation launched 'e-Office' application in over 500 of its offices to improve e-governance?
option1: Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC)
answer: Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC)
explanation:
The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has launched 'e-Office' application in over 500 GST and customs offices.
The application has been developed by the National Informatics Centre (NIC).  This will enable the automation of internal processes of handling files that have been handled manually and help improve e-governance. Over 50000 officers and staff will use this application.
